body:
Current Behavior:
Our tool currently extracts the raw Markdown content from GitHub issue and Pull Request (PR) descriptions. This raw content includes HTML-style comments (e.g., `<!-- This is a comment -->`). While these comments are invisible when rendered on GitHub, they are currently included in the text passed to Large Language Models (LLMs).

Problem:
Including these HTML comments in the input to LLMs is undesirable for several reasons:

1. Increased Token Usage: Comments, even if hidden, consume valuable tokens, leading to higher processing costs.
2. Potential LLM Confusion/Noise: Irrelevant or internal-facing comments can act as noise, potentially confusing the LLM or degrading the quality of its output.
3. Accidental Information Leakage: Comments might contain draft notes, internal discussions, or sensitive information not intended to be processed or seen by the LLM or its subsequent outputs.

Proposed Solution:
Modify the tool to parse and remove all HTML-style comments (`<!-- ... -->`) from the fetched issue/PR descriptions before the content is sent to the LLM.
title: feat: Strip HTML comments from issue/PR descriptions before LLM processing
